admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
Even though none of the loan money for
            the Fourth Education Project for Greece had been disbursed,
            specific aspects of the project were a success.  These
            included: higher technical and vocational education centers
            (KATE) and vocational and technical education centers (
            KETE), which were set up in temporary locations, were
            generally accepted,  secondary education officials and
            teachers  (SELME) was developed which improved
            administration and teaching, designs and contracts were
            drawn for fifteen new educational institutions, contracts
            and specification documents were created for all seventy-six
            project institutions, and Ministry of National Education and
            Religious Affairs' implementation agencies were
            developed. The Government decided to go forth with the
            project and was committed to its completion.  The
            project's physical aspects as a whole were poorly
            implemented.  An example is none of the fifteen new
            institutions in the project were built or equipped.
